titleStmt.title: W. F. Geiger et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5217

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioners would Respectfully and Earnestly Join in the Prayer of the Petitioners Lindsey Smith Joseph Hatton and Others (Indicted for the Hanging of Wm Wright and the Lyones the murderer of Geo P Archer) For their Pardon we know many of the men and know that they Have always stood as Good Citizens and Quiet and Peacable Citizens

W. F. Geiger
J. C. Downrain
Jas Killgore
J C Kely
John. P. Jones
J. J. McNeel
John W Poage
C. S. Raison
John Hammond
M.L. Williams Jr
A. C. Campbell
H Davis
R W Lamptire
B. F. Powers
R. D. Brainard
Jas Sullivan
F. C. Powers

Aleck Mcnell
P B Frazier

W D Cearny
Mit. B. Pollard
L. E. Shepard
E. B. Wilhort
